text: William Goldwyn "Bill" Nunn III (October 20, 1953 – September 24, 2016) was an American actor. He was known for his roles as Radio Raheem in Spike Lee's movie Do the Right Thing and Robbie Robertson in the Sam Raimi Spider-Man movie trilogy. He was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Nunn died of leukemia at his home in Pittsburgh's Hill District on September 24, 2016, aged 62.Bill Nunn, Who Played Radio Raheem in ‘Do the Right Thing,’ Dies at 63 == References == == Other websites == * Category:1953 births Category:2016 deaths Category:African-American movie actors Category:African-American television actors Category:Cancer deaths in Pennsylvania Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:Actors from Pittsburgh
title: Bill Nunn
